alert.note: Alert for Dona Ana; Luna (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 13 at 10:16PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM MDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central New Mexico and southwest New Mexico, including the following counties, in south central New Mexico, Dona Ana. In southwest New Mexico, Luna. * WHEN...Until 115 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1015 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall of up to 1 inch is expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Akela, portions of I-10. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
